group_1.narration: Presently, I am rooting for Lady Cornelia's love.
The love interest is her childhood friend,@Lord Marius...
And the rival is Cornelia's younger twin sister,@Lady Junia!
The truth is, I'm actually the handmaiden@of said Lady Junia.
Which means... I'm a traitor!
Whenever an opportunity presents itself,@I will use it as an excuse to get all sorts of ideas@into Lady Cornelia's head.
Ludus—@An intellectual board game, it makes for a@modest pleasure during waiting times...

group_1.textLeft: *Sigh*... Another complete defeat in today's@match of Ludus.

group_1.textRight: Shall we return to our rooms?

group_1.textLeft: Right!
After midday, Lord Marius will be here to@pick you up.
There is still plenty of time,
but I suggest we start packing well in advance...

group_1.narration: Lord Marius's father is one of the@most powerful men in Pompeii...
Depending on who gets engaged to Lord Marius,@the city council...the town's future policies@will change drastically.
And the two leading candidates for Lord Marius's@fiancée are Lady Cornelia and Lady Junia!

group_1.textRight: Junia will be late, correct?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. She will be going directly to the amphitheatre!

group_1.textRight: So the three of us get to watch the race@together today.
I'm looking forward to it.

group_1.narration: Lady Junia was adopted at an early age and@lives separately from Lady Cornelia,@but the two of them are extremely close.
Their fathers are also dear friends, and they're@both great merchants in their own right...@It's just that their families' businesses are different.
So, even though the two girls are twin sisters, the fate@of the town depends on which one of them gets engaged...!

group_1.textCenter: (If Lord Marius becomes engaged to Lady Junia...)

group_1.narration: What awaits us is a future in which the inevitable calamity@destined to befall this town shall strike us next year...
When that day comes, everyone will fail to escape in time@and most of the townspeople will lose their lives.
It would be the result of local industrialists hesitating until@the last minute to abandon their town and evacuate.
...I come from such a future.
Transcending time, to prevent the same tragedy@from happening again.

group_1.textRight: ...Were you thinking back to what happened in@the future?

group_1.textLeft: Ah... Yes.

group_1.textRight: I don't know if I should be having a frolic like this,
when there is so much to be done to@save everyone...

group_1.textLeft: I mean, there's nothing else we can do@today anyway.
Besides, in order to secure your engagement,
I would like you to watch the race today and@deepen your friendship with Lord Marius!

group_1.narration: I have told Lady Cornelia all about it,@and she's been helping me in various ways to@make sure that everyone else in the town can escape, too.
Spreading the prophecy of imminent doom,@encouraging the influential to evacuate and emigrate so@that they will become the majority...
Thanks to these efforts, the tide is turning.@And for this trend to be decisive, the engagement of@Lord Marius and Lady Cornelia is of the utmost importance!
At first, Lady Cornelia was reluctant to pursue love, perhaps@because of her reservations about Lady Junia, but...
After much prodding from me,@she came to be honest with her feelings.

group_1.textLeft: Now, in order to influence your father's will...
It's important that you and Lord Marius grow@closer than you are now.
So, today...

group_1.textRight: Erm... We're just going to watch the chariot races@together, you know?

group_1.textLeft: What are you talking about?@Watching a race is a golden opportunity
for men and women to hang out together in@a very natural way, you know!
It's a valuable way to strengthen rapport,
recommended by even the great Ovidius in@"The Art of Love"!
And you, Lady Cornelia, have a special seat!
It's your privilege as the owner of the popular@charioteer, Hilarus the Left-Handed!
The mood of you two will be at its best...!

group_1.textRight: You really are what Miyurin called a hop...@what was the word again?

group_1.textLeft: ..."Hopeless romantic"?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that's it.

group_1.textLeft: Hmmm... If I'm going to be complimented, I'd rather@be called a "schemer" or something like that.

group_1.textRight: I didn't mean that as a compliment, though...

group_1.textLeft: What...?
...Oh yeah, and by the way.@After the game, please remember
not to stop by that temple of goddess Venus@that's currently in reconstruction.

group_1.textRight: Why not?

group_1.textLeft: As I recall, there's going to be a ghostly disturbance@in that area today...

group_1.textRight: So that's what happened in the future you@experienced?

group_1.textLeft: Indeed... I'm not sure if it will happen again,@but just in case.

group_1.textRight: Thank you, I understand.@Now then...
Let's clean this up, shall we?
I'd like to start preparing to welcome Lord Marius.

group_1.textLeft: Yes!
This is where you keep the game board, isn't it?

group_1.textRight: You are the handmaiden of another house, yet@you seem to know that better than me.

group_1.textLeft: Ehe, that's exactly right...!@All right, let's neatly wrap this up and—

group_1.narration: *Ka-tap*...

group_1.textLeft: ...?@[wait:0.8][chara:105301:lipSynch_1]What is this...?

group_1.textRight: ...Let me have a look.

group_1.narration: *Po-wah-wan*

group_1.textLeft: H-huh... It made a sound!

group_1.textRight: That's not all...!
What is...this?@It's reflecting people's faces...?
